election_record.label: South Carolina 1806 House of Representatives, Greenville District

overview.note: "It appeared on counting the votes, that Mr. Edwards had but two votes more than J. H. Harrison, and on counting the votes for a member of Congress, the next day, three votes were found amongst them for Mr. Harrison, so that he, of right, Elected." The Times (Charleston, SC). October 27, 1806.

The results of this election were contested by supporters of John Hampton Harrison, who alleged that several votes for Harrison were mistakenly put in the box for a member of Congress by the managers. Ultimately, the elections of John Blasingame and Thomas Edwards were upheld.

election_record.reference: City Gazette and Daily Advertiser (Charleston, SC). October 27, 1806.
